smell_analysis.justification: No empty diagrams were found. All 19 pages contain at least one element. Every diagram (package, use case, activity, class, state, and database diagrams) contains visual elements.

On page 2 'Autode funktsionaalne allsüsteem (Vaata & Tuvasta)', the use case 'Tuvasta kasutaja' (Identify user) is shown as an oval element within the system boundary but has no association line connecting it to any actor. The five actors (Uudistaja, Klienditeenindaja, Juhataja, Klient, Autode haldur) are positioned around the boundary but only connect to the 'Vaata' use cases. Therefore, at least one use case oval has ZERO actor associations.

No duplicate use case activities with the same actor were found. All use cases describe distinct activities: 'Tuvasta kasutaja', 'Vaata aktiivseid autosid', 'Vaata kõiki autosid', 'Vaata autode koondaruannet' (page 2), and 'Registreeri auto', 'Lõpeta auto', 'Muuda autot', 'Aktiveeri auto', 'Muuda auto mitteaktiivseks', 'Vaata kõiki ootel või mitteaktiivseid autosid', 'Unusta auto' (page 3). Each describes a unique action.

No duplicate element names exist within any single package. Each register package (Isikute register, Klassifikaatorite register, Töötajate register, Autode register, Klientide register) contains uniquely named elements.

While multiple tables contain columns like 'nimetus' and 'on_aktiivne', these represent different contextual data in each classifier table (Auto_kategooria, Riik, Isiku_seisundi_liik, etc.) and are not redundant copies of the same data value. Per the rule, identically named columns in unrelated tables representing different contexts are NOT redundancy.

All use cases follow a consistent verb-first naming pattern. Pages 2-3 use cases: 'Tuvasta kasutaja' (Identify), 'Vaata aktiivseid autosid' (View), 'Vaata kõiki autosid' (View), 'Vaata autode koondaruannet' (View), 'Registreeri auto' (Register), 'Lõpeta auto' (End), 'Muuda autot' (Change), 'Aktiveeri auto' (Activate), 'Muuda auto mitteaktiivseks' (Change), 'Unusta auto' (Forget). All start with active verbs.

On page 9 'Auto seisundidiagramm', all states are reachable. States: Algus (start), Ootel, Aktiivne, Mitteaktiivne, Lõpetatud, Unustatud. Transitions show: Algus→Ootel (registration), Ootel→Aktiivne, Ootel→Unustatud, Aktiivne→Mitteaktiivne, Mitteaktiivne→Aktiivne, Aktiivne→Lõpetatud, Mitteaktiivne→Lõpetatud. Every state has at least one incoming transition path.

On page 4 'Auto lõpetamise tegevusdiagramm', all actions are reachable from the start node (Algus). The flow: Algus→'Vaata kõiki autosid'→decision→'Otsi autot' or continue→decision→'Vali auto'→'Lõpeta valitud auto'→decision→loop or Lõpp. All actions have incoming flows.

All relationships in class and database diagrams have multiplicity indicators on both ends. Examples: Page 5 shows '1' and '0..*' on Isik-Auto relationships; Page 6 shows '1' and '0..1' on Isik-Kasutajakonto; Pages 14-19 database diagrams show multiplicities like '0..*', '1', '0..1' on all FK relationships. Every association/relationship has multiplicity on BOTH ends.

No diagram has ≥10 central elements. Counts per diagram: Page 2 (use cases)=4, Page 3=7, Page 4 (actions)=4, Page 5 (classes)=3, Page 6=6, Page 7=6, Page 8=6, Page 9 (states)=6, Page 10=5, Page 11=3, Page 12=7, Page 13=3, Page 14 (tables)=4, Page 15=9, Page 16=3, Page 17=6, Page 18=2, Page 19=5. Maximum is 9 tables on page 15 'Klassifikaatorite register'. Threshold is ≥10. Since 9 < 10, smell is NOT present.

No element has ≥6 visual connection lines on any single diagram. Maximum connections counted: Page 5: Isik has 3 lines; Page 6: Isik has 3 lines; Page 7: Klassifikaator has 5 inheritance lines; Page 12: Auto has 4 lines; Page 15: Auto_kategooria has 1 line; Page 17: Auto has 4 lines; Page 19: Tootaja has 4 lines. Maximum is 5 lines from Klassifikaator on page 7. Threshold is ≥6. Since 5 < 6, smell is NOT present.

Visual inspection of all diagrams shows related elements are positioned near each other. No relationship distances appear to exceed twice the average distance between elements. Elements are logically grouped (e.g., classifier tables together on page 15, Auto-related tables near Auto on page 17).

All use cases and activity actions start with active verbs. Use cases: 'Tuvasta' (Identify), 'Vaata' (View), 'Registreeri' (Register), 'Lõpeta' (End), 'Muuda' (Change), 'Aktiveeri' (Activate), 'Unusta' (Forget). Activity actions (page 4): 'Vaata kõiki autosid', 'Otsi autot', 'Vali auto', 'Lõpeta valitud auto' - all verb-first.

All names have ≥4 characters. Shortest class/table names: 'Isik' (4 chars), 'Auto' (4 chars), 'Riik' (4 chars). Shortest attribute names: 'kood' (4 chars). All use case names are phrases with multiple words. Threshold is ≤3 characters. Since minimum length is 4, which is > 3, smell is NOT present.

All class names start with uppercase and are singular. Examples: Isik, Auto, Klient, Töötaja, Kasutajakonto, Klassifikaator, Riik, Auto_seisundi_liik, Auto_kategooria, Auto_mark, Auto_kütuse_liik, Töötaja_roll, etc. No lowercase starts or plural names found.

All attribute and column names start with lowercase letters. Examples from class diagrams: e_meil, eesnimi, isikukood, nimetus, on_aktiivne, kood. Examples from database tables: isik_id, isikukood, riik_kood, nimetus, kirjeldus, on_aktiivne, auto_kood, tootaja_roll_kood. No uppercase-starting attributes found.

All database table names are singular. Tables: Isik, Kasutajakonto, Tootaja_roll, Auto_kategooria, Auto_kategooria_tyyp, Auto_kytuse_liik, Isiku_seisundi_liik, Kliendi_seisundi_liik, Riik, Tootaja_seisundi_liik, Auto_mark, Klient, Auto, Auto_kategooria_omamine, Tootaja, Tootaja_rolli_omamine. No plural table names found.

No type prefixes found in class, table, or attribute names. The only prefixes used are PK_, FK_, pfK, and IXFK_ which are explicitly allowed per the rule for indicating primary keys, foreign keys, partial foreign keys, and indexes. No tbl_, uc_, str, int, or other type abbreviation prefixes were found.
